title: Transport for London Unified
description: Our unified API brings together data across all modes of transport into a single RESTful API. This API provides access to the most highly requested realtime and status infomation across all the modes of transport, in a single and consistent way. Access to the developer documentation is available at https://api.tfl.gov.uk

id.description: Id of the bike point such as BikePoints_1

name.description: Name / Common name of the bike point

passengerFlows.description: Busiest times at a station (static information)

trainLoadings.description: Train Loading on a scale 1-6, 1 being "Very quiet" and 6 being "Exceptionally busy" (static information)

geography.description: A LineString or MultiLineString that forms the route of the highway

id.description: The Id

label.description: The long label to show on maps when zoomed in

labelShort.description: The short label to show on maps

modified.description: When the data was last updated

segmented.description: True if the route is split into segments

Disruption.description: Represents a disruption to a route within the transport network.

additionalInfo.description: Gets or sets the additionaInfo of this disruption.

affectedRoutes.description: Gets or sets the routes affected by this disruption

affectedStops.description: Gets or sets the stops affected by this disruption

category.description: Gets or sets the category of this dispruption.

categoryDescription.description: Gets or sets the description of the category.

created.description: Gets or sets the date/time when this disruption was created.

description.description: Gets or sets the description of this disruption.

lastUpdate.description: Gets or sets the date/time when this disruption was last updated.

summary.description: Gets or sets the summary of this disruption.

type.description: Gets or sets the disruption type of this dispruption.

Disruption.title: Disruption

address.description: A string describing the formatted address of the place. Adds additional context to the place's Name.

types.description: The type of the place e.g. "street_address"

ItineraryResult.description: A DTO representing a list of possible journeys.
ItineraryResult.title: ItineraryResult

Journey.description: Object that represents an end to end journey (see schematic).
Journey.title: Journey

instruction.description:
Describes the action the user need to take for this section, E.g. "walk to the
            district line"

direction.description: eg: N or S or I or O

timeSlice.description: Time in 24hr format with 15 minute intervals e.g. 0500-0515, 0515-0530 etc.

value.description: Count of passenger flow towards a platform

additionalProperties.description: A bag of additional key/value pairs with extra information about this place.

distance.description:
The distance of the place from its search point, if this is the result
            of a geographical search, otherwise zero.

id.description: A unique identifier.

placeType.description: The type of Place. See /Place/Meta/placeTypes for possible values.

url.description: The unique location of this resource.

Point.description: Represents a point located at a latitude and longitude using the WGS84 co-ordinate system.
Point.title: Point

Prediction.description: DTO to capture the prediction details

currentLocation.description: The current location of the vehicle.

destinationNaptanId.description: Naptan Identifier for the prediction's destination

expectedArrival.description: The expected arrival time of the vehicle at the stop/station

id.description: The identitier for the prediction

modeName.description: The mode name of the station/line the prediction relates to

operationType.description: The type of the operation (1: is new or has been updated, 2: should be deleted from any client cache)

platformName.description: Platform name (for bus, this is the stop letter)

timeToLive.description: The expiry time for the prediction

timeToStation.description: Prediction of the Time to station in seconds

timestamp.description: Timestamp for when the prediction was inserted/modified (source column drives what objects are broadcast on each iteration)

timing.description: Keep the original timestamp from MongoDb fo debugging purposes

towards.description: Routing information or other descriptive text about the path of the vehicle towards the destination

vehicleId.description: The actual vehicle in transit (for train modes, the leading car of the rolling set)

Prediction.title: Prediction

bounds.description:
The Bounds of the Corridor, given by the south-east followed by the north-west co-ordinate
            pair in geoJSON format e.g. "[[-1.241531,51.242151],[1.641223,53.765721]]"

displayName.description:
The display name of the Corridor e.g. "North Circular (A406)". This
            may be identical to the Id.

envelope.description:
The Envelope of the Corridor, given by the corner co-ordinates of a rectangular (four-point) polygon
            in geoJSON format e.g. "[[-1.241531,51.242151],[-1.241531,53.765721],[1.641223,53.765721],[1.641223,51.242151]]"

group.description: The group name of the Corridor e.g. "Central London". Most corridors are not grouped, in which case this field can be null.

id.description: The Id of the Corridor e.g. "A406"

statusAggregationEndDate.description: The end of the period over which status has been aggregated, or null if this is the current corridor status.

statusAggregationStartDate.description: The start of the period over which status has been aggregated, or null if this is the current corridor status.

statusSeverityDescription.description: Description of the status severity as applied to RoadCorridors

category.description: Describes the nature of disruption e.g. Traffic Incidents, Works

comments.description: Full text of comments describing the disruption, including details of any road closures and diversions, where appropriate.

corridorIds.description: The Ids of affected corridors, if any.

currentUpdate.description:
Text of the most recent update from the LSTCC on the state of the
             disruption, including the current traffic impact and any advice to
             road users.

currentUpdateDateTime.description:
The time when the last CurrentUpdate description was recorded, 
            or null if no CurrentUpdate has been applied.

endDateTime.description:
The date and time on which the disruption ended. For planned disruptions, this date will have a valid value. For unplanned 
            disruptions in progress, this field will be omitted.

geography.description:
Geography version of Point for output as GeoJSON.
            Can not use Geometry in a consistent way as non-TIMS disruptions do not have a polygon

geometry.description:
GeoJSON formatted latitude/longitude (WGS84) pairs forming an enclosed polyline or polygon. The polygon will only be included where affected streets information
            is not available for the disruption, would be inappropriate (e.g. a very large number of streets), or is centred on an area without streets (e.g. a football stadium).

hasClosures.description:
True if any of the affected Streets have a "Full Closure" status, false otherwise. A RoadDisruption that has HasClosures is considered a 
            Severe or Serious disruption for severity filtering purposes.

id.description: Unique identifier for the road disruption

isProvisional.description: True if the disruption is planned on a future date that is open to change

lastModifiedTime.description:
The date and time on which the disruption was last modified in the system. This information can reliably be used by a developer to quickly
            compare two instances of the same disruption to determine if it has been changed.

levelOfInterest.description:
This describes the level of potential impact on traffic operations of the disruption. 
            High = e.g. a one-off disruption on a major or high profile route which will require a high level of operational attention 
            Medium = This is the default value 
            Low = e.g. a frequently occurring disruption which is well known

linkText.description: The text of any associated link

linkUrl.description: The url of any associated link

location.description: Main road name / number (borough) or preset area name where the disruption is located. This might be useful for a map popup where space is limited.

ordinal.description: An ordinal of the disruption based on severity, level of interest and corridor.

point.description: Latitude and longitude (WGS84) of the centroid of the disruption, stored in a geoJSON-formatted string.

severity.description: A description of the severity of the disruption.

startDateTime.description:
The date and time which the disruption started. For a planned disruption (i.e. planned road works) this date will be in the future.
            For unplanned disruptions, this will default to the date on which the disruption was first recorded, but may be adjusted by the operator.

status.description:
This describes the status of the disruption.  
            Active = currently in progress 
            Active Long Term = currently in progress and long term
            Scheduled = scheduled to start within the next 180 days
            Recurring Works = planned maintenance works that follow a regular routine or pattern and whose next occurrence is to start within the next 180 days.
            Recently Cleared = recently cleared in the last 24 hours
            Note that the status of Scheduled or Recurring Works disruptions will change to Active when they start, and will change status again when they end.

streets.description: A collection of zero or more streets affected by the disruption.

subCategory.description: Describes the sub-category of disruption e.g. Collapsed Manhole, Abnormal Load

url.description: URL to retrieve this road disruption

id.description: The Id of the route

lineIdentifier.description: The line identifier (e.g. District Line), from where you can obtain line status information e.g. the rainbow board status "good service".

direction.description: eg: N or S or I or O

id.description: The Id of the route

additionalProperties.description: A bag of additional key/value pairs with extra information about this place.

distance.description:
The distance of the place from its search point, if this is the result
            of a geographical search, otherwise zero.

id.description: A unique identifier.

indicator.description: The indicator of the stop point e.g. "Stop K"

placeType.description: The type of Place. See /Place/Meta/placeTypes for possible values.

stopLetter.description: The stop letter, if it could be cleansed from the Indicator e.g. "K"

url.description: The unique location of this resource.

nextBranchIds.description:
The ids of the next branch(es) in the sequence. Note that the next and previous branch id can be
            identical in the case of a looped route e.g. the Circle line.

prevBranchIds.description:
The ids of the previous branch(es) in the sequence. Note that the next and previous branch id can be
            identical in the case of a looped route e.g. the Circle line.

centrePoint.description: The centre latitude/longitude of this list of StopPoints

pageSize.description: The maximum size of the page in this response i.e. the maximum number of StopPoints

total.description: The total number of StopPoints available across all pages

closure.description:
Type of road closure. Some example values:
            Open = road is open, not blocked, not closed, not restricted. It maybe that the disruption has been moved out of the carriageway.
            Partial Closure = road is partially blocked, closed or restricted. 
            Full Closure = road is fully blocked or closed.

directions.description:
The direction of the disruption on the street. Some example values:
            All Directions
            All Approaches
            Clockwise
            Anti-Clockwise
            Northbound
            Eastbound
            Southbound
            Westbound
            Both Directions

segments.description: Geographic description of the sections of this street that are affected.

sourceSystemId.description: The ID from the source system of the disruption that this street belongs to.

sourceSystemKey.description: The key of the source system of the disruption that this street belongs to.

lineString.description: geoJSON formatted LineString containing two latitude/longitude (WGS84) pairs that identify the start and end points of the street segment.

sourceSystemId.description: The ID from the source system of the disruption that this street belongs to.

sourceSystemKey.description: The key of the source system of the disruption that this street belongs to.

toid.description: A 16 digit unique integer identifying a OS ITN (Ordnance Survey Integrated Transport Network) road link.

direction.description: Direction in regards to Journey Planner i.e. inbound or outbound

lineDirection.description: Direction of the Line e.g. NB, SB, WB etc.

platformDirection.description: Direction displayed on the platform e.g. NB, SB, WB etc.

timeSlice.description: Time in 24hr format with 15 minute intervals e.g. 0500-0515, 0515-0530 etc.

value.description:
Scale between 1-6, 
             1 = Very quiet, 2 = Quiet, 3 = Fairly busy, 4 = Busy, 5 = Very busy, 6 = Exceptionally busy

ValidityPeriod.description: Represents a period for which a planned works is valid.

fromDate.description: Gets or sets the start date.

isNow.description: If true is a realtime status rather than planned or info

toDate.description: Gets or sets the end date.

ValidityPeriod.title: ValidityPeriod

actions.title: AccidentStats_Get
actions.description: Gets all accident details for accidents occuring in the specified year

year.description: The year for which to filter the accidents on.

actions.title: AirQuality_Get
actions.description: Gets air quality data feed

actions.title: BikePoint_GetAll
actions.description:
Gets all bike point locations. The Place object has an addtionalProperties array which contains the nbBikes, nbDocks and nbSpaces
            numbers which give the status of the BikePoint. A mismatch in these numbers i.e. nbDocks - (nbBikes + nbSpaces) != 0 indicates broken docks.

actions.title: BikePoint_Search
actions.description:
Search for bike stations by their name, a bike point's name often contains information about the name of the street
            or nearby landmarks, for example. Note that the search result does not contain the PlaceProperties i.e. the status
            or occupancy of the BikePoint, to get that information you should retrieve the BikePoint by its id on /BikePoint/id.

actions.title: BikePoint_Get
actions.description: Gets the bike point with the given id.

id.description: A bike point id (a list of ids can be obtained from the above BikePoint call)

actions.title: Cabwise_Get
actions.description: Gets taxis and minicabs contact information

optype.description: Operator Type e.g Minicab, Executive, Limousine

radius.description: The radius of the bounding circle in metres

maxResults.description: An optional parameter to limit the number of results return. Default and maximum is 20.

actions.title: Journey_JourneyResults
actions.description: Perform a Journey Planner search from the parameters specified in simple types

from.description: Origin of the journey. Can be WGS84 coordinates expressed as "lat,long", a UK postcode, a Naptan (StopPoint) id, an ICS StopId, or a free-text string (will cause disambiguation unless it exactly matches a point of interest name).

to.description: Destination of the journey. Can be WGS84 coordinates expressed as "lat,long", a UK postcode, a Naptan (StopPoint) id, an ICS StopId, or a free-text string (will cause disambiguation unless it exactly matches a point of interest name).

via.description: Travel through point on the journey. Can be WGS84 coordinates expressed as "lat,long", a UK postcode, a Naptan (StopPoint) id, an ICS StopId, or a free-text string (will cause disambiguation unless it exactly matches a point of interest name).

nationalSearch.description: Does the journey cover stops outside London? eg. "nationalSearch=true"

date.description: The date must be in yyyyMMdd format

time.description: The time must be in HHmm format

timeIs.description: Does the time given relate to arrival or leaving time? Possible options: "departing" | "arriving"

journeyPreference.description: The journey preference eg possible options: "leastinterchange" | "leasttime" | "leastwalking"

mode.description: The mode must be a comma separated list of modes. eg possible options: "public-bus,overground,train,tube,coach,dlr,cablecar,tram,river,walking,cycle"

accessibilityPreference.description: The accessibility preference must be a comma separated list eg. "noSolidStairs,noEscalators,noElevators,stepFreeToVehicle,stepFreeToPlatform"

fromName.description: An optional name to associate with the origin of the journey in the results.

toName.description: An optional name to associate with the destination of the journey in the results.

viaName.description: An optional name to associate with the via point of the journey in the results.

maxTransferMinutes.description: The max walking time in minutes for transfer eg. "120"

maxWalkingMinutes.description: The max walking time in minutes for journeys eg. "120"

walkingSpeed.description: The walking speed. eg possible options: "slow" | "average" | "fast".

cyclePreference.description: The cycle preference. eg possible options: "allTheWay" | "leaveAtStation" | "takeOnTransport" | "cycleHire"

adjustment.description: Time adjustment command. eg possible options: "TripFirst" | "TripLast"

bikeProficiency.description: A comma separated list of cycling proficiency levels. eg possible options: "easy,moderate,fast"

alternativeCycle.description: Option to determine whether to return alternative cycling journey

alternativeWalking.description: Option to determine whether to return alternative walking journey

applyHtmlMarkup.description: Flag to determine whether certain text (e.g. walking instructions) should be output with HTML tags or not.

useMultiModalCall.description: A boolean to indicate whether or not to return 3 public transport journeys, a bus journey, a cycle hire journey, a personal cycle journey and a walking journey

walkingOptimization.description: A boolean to indicate whether to optimize journeys using walking

taxiOnlyTrip.description: A boolean to indicate whether to return one or more taxi journeys. Note, setting this to true will override "useMultiModalCall".

actions.title: Journey_Meta
actions.description: Gets a list of all of the available journey planner modes

actions.title: Line_MetaDisruptionCategories
actions.description: Gets a list of valid disruption categories

actions.title: Line_MetaModes
actions.description: Gets a list of valid modes

actions.title: Line_MetaServiceTypes
actions.description: Gets a list of valid ServiceTypes to filter on

actions.title: Line_MetaSeverity
actions.description: Gets a list of valid severity codes

actions.title: Line_GetByMode
actions.description: Gets lines that serve the given modes.

modes.description: A comma-separated list of modes e.g. tube,dlr

actions.title: Line_DisruptionByMode
actions.description: Get disruptions for all lines of the given modes.

modes.description: A comma-separated list of modes e.g. tube,dlr

actions.title: Line_RouteByMode
actions.description: Gets all lines and their valid routes for given modes, including the name and id of the originating and terminating stops for each route

modes.description: A comma-separated list of modes e.g. tube,dlr

serviceTypes.description: A comma seperated list of service types to filter on. Supported values: Regular, Night. Defaulted to 'Regular' if not specified

actions.title: Line_StatusByMode
actions.description: Gets the line status of for all lines for the given modes

modes.description: A comma-separated list of modes to filter by. e.g. tube,dlr

detail.description: Include details of the disruptions that are causing the line status including the affected stops and routes

actions.title: Line_Route
actions.description: Get all valid routes for all lines, including the name and id of the originating and terminating stops for each route.

serviceTypes.description: A comma seperated list of service types to filter on. Supported values: Regular, Night. Defaulted to 'Regular' if not specified

actions.title: Line_Search
actions.description: Search for lines or routes matching the query string

modes.description: Optionally filter by the specified modes

serviceTypes.description: A comma seperated list of service types to filter on. Supported values: Regular, Night. Defaulted to 'Regular' if not specified

actions.title: Line_StatusBySeverity
actions.description:
Gets the line status for all lines with a given severity
            A list of valid severity codes can be obtained from a call to Line/Meta/Severity

severity.description: The level of severity (eg: a number from 0 to 14)

actions.title: Line_Get
actions.description: Gets lines that match the specified line ids.

ids.description: A comma-separated list of line ids e.g. victoria,circle,N133. Max. approx. 20 ids.

actions.title: Line_Arrivals
actions.description: Get the list of arrival predictions for given line ids based at the given stop

ids.description: A comma-separated list of line ids e.g. victoria,circle,N133. Max. approx. 20 ids.

stopPointId.description: Optional. Id of stop to get arrival predictions for (station naptan code e.g. 940GZZLUASL, you can use /StopPoint/Search/{query} endpoint to find a stop point id from a station name)

direction.description: Optional. The direction of travel. Can be inbound or outbound or all. If left blank, and destinationStopId is set, will default to all

actions.title: Line_Disruption
actions.description: Get disruptions for the given line ids

ids.description: A comma-separated list of line ids e.g. victoria,circle,N133. Max. approx. 20 ids.

actions.title: Line_LineRoutesByIds
actions.description: Get all valid routes for given line ids, including the name and id of the originating and terminating stops for each route.

ids.description: A comma-separated list of line ids e.g. victoria,circle,N133. Max. approx. 20 ids.

serviceTypes.description: A comma seperated list of service types to filter on. Supported values: Regular, Night. Defaulted to 'Regular' if not specified

actions.title: Line_StatusByIds
actions.description: Gets the line status of for given line ids e.g Minor Delays

ids.description: A comma-separated list of line ids e.g. victoria,circle,N133. Max. approx. 20 ids.

detail.description: Include details of the disruptions that are causing the line status including the affected stops and routes

actions.title: Line_Status
actions.description: Gets the line status for given line ids during the provided dates e.g Minor Delays

ids.description: A comma-separated list of line ids e.g. victoria,circle,N133. Max. approx. 20 ids.

detail.description: Include details of the disruptions that are causing the line status including the affected stops and routes

actions.title: Line_RouteSequence
actions.description: Gets all valid routes for given line id, including the sequence of stops on each route.

id.description: A single line id e.g. victoria

direction.description: The direction of travel. Can be inbound or outbound.

serviceTypes.description: A comma seperated list of service types to filter on. Supported values: Regular, Night. Defaulted to 'Regular' if not specified

excludeCrowding.description: That excludes crowding from line disruptions. Can be true or false.

actions.title: Line_StopPoints
actions.description: Gets a list of the stations that serve the given line id

id.description: A single line id e.g. victoria

actions.title: Line_Timetable
actions.description: Gets the timetable for a specified station on the give line

fromStopPointId.description: The originating station's stop point id (station naptan code e.g. 940GZZLUASL, you can use /StopPoint/Search/{query} endpoint to find a stop point id from a station name)

id.description: A single line id e.g. victoria

actions.title: Line_TimetableTo
actions.description: Gets the timetable for a specified station on the give line with specified destination

fromStopPointId.description: The originating station's stop point id (station naptan code e.g. 940GZZLUASL, you can use /StopPoint/Search/{query} endpoint to find a stop point id from a station name)

id.description: A single line id e.g. victoria

actions.title: Mode_GetActiveServiceTypes
actions.description:
Returns the service type active for a mode.
            Currently only supports tube

actions.title: Mode_Arrivals
actions.description: Gets the next arrival predictions for all stops of a given mode

mode.description: A mode name e.g. tube, dlr

count.description: A number of arrivals to return for each stop, -1 to return all available.

actions.title: Occupancy_GetBikePointsOccupancies
actions.description: Get the occupancy for bike points.

actions.title: Occupancy.CarPark.get
actions.description: Gets the occupancy for all car parks that have occupancy data

actions.title: Occupancy.CarPark.id.get
actions.description: Gets the occupancy for a car park with a given id

actions.title: Occupancy_GetAllChargeConnectorStatus
actions.description: Gets the occupancy for all charge connectors

actions.title: Occupancy_GetChargeConnectorStatus
actions.description: Gets the occupancy for a charge connectors with a given id (sourceSystemPlaceId)

actions.title: Place_GetByGeoBox
actions.description:
Gets the places that lie within the bounding box defined by the lat/lon of its north-west and south-east corners. Optionally filters
            on type and can strip properties for a smaller payload.

categories.description: an optional list of comma separated property categories to return in the Place's property bag. If null or empty, all categories of property are returned. Pass the keyword "none" to return no properties (a valid list of categories can be obtained from the /Place/Meta/categories endpoint)

includeChildren.description: Defaults to false. If true child places e.g. individual charging stations at a charge point while be included, otherwise just the URLs of any child places will be returned

type.description: place types to filter on, or null to return all types

activeOnly.description: An optional parameter to limit the results to active records only (Currently only the 'VariableMessageSign' place type is supported)

actions.title: Place_GetStreetsByPostCode
actions.description: Gets the set of streets associated with a post code.

actions.title: Place_MetaCategories
actions.description: Gets a list of all of the available place property categories and keys.

actions.title: Place_MetaPlaceTypes
actions.description: Gets a list of the available types of Place.

actions.title: Place_Search
actions.description: Gets all places that matches the given query

name.description: The name of the place, you can use the /Place/Types/{types} endpoint to get a list of places for a given type including their names.

types.description: A comma-separated list of the types to return. Max. approx 12 types.

actions.title: Place_GetByType
actions.description: Gets all places of a given type

types.description:
A comma-separated list of the types to return. Max. approx 12 types.
            A valid list of place types can be obtained from the /Place/Meta/placeTypes endpoint.

activeOnly.description: An optional parameter to limit the results to active records only (Currently only the 'VariableMessageSign' place type is supported)

actions.title: Place_Get
actions.description: Gets the place with the given id.

id.description: The id of the place, you can use the /Place/Types/{types} endpoint to get a list of places for a given type including their ids

includeChildren.description: Defaults to false. If true child places e.g. individual charging stations at a charge point while be included, otherwise just the URLs of any child places will be returned

actions.title: Place_GetAt
actions.description:
Gets any places of the given type whose geography intersects the given latitude and longitude. In practice this means the Place
            must be polygonal e.g. a BoroughBoundary.

type.description: The place type (a valid list of place types can be obtained from the /Place/Meta/placeTypes endpoint)

actions.title: Place_GetOverlay
actions.description: Gets the place overlay for a given set of co-ordinates and a given width/height.

type.description: The place type (a valid list of place types can be obtained from the /Place/Meta/placeTypes endpoint)

width.description: The width of the requested overlay.

height.description: The height of the requested overlay.

actions.title: Road.get
actions.description: Gets all roads managed by TfL

actions.title: Road_MetaCategories
actions.description: Gets a list of valid RoadDisruption categories

actions.title: Road_MetaSeverities
actions.description: Gets a list of valid RoadDisruption severity codes

actions.title: Road_DisruptionById
actions.description: Gets a list of active disruptions filtered by disruption Ids.

disruptionIds.description: Comma-separated list of disruption identifiers to filter by.

stripContent.description: Optional, defaults to false. When true, removes every property/node except for id, point, severity, severityDescription, startDate, endDate, corridor details, location and comments.

actions.title: Road_DisruptedStreets
actions.description: Gets a list of disrupted streets. If no date filters are provided, current disruptions are returned.

startDate.description: Optional, the start time to filter on.

endDate.description: Optional, The end time to filter on.

actions.title: Road.ids.get
actions.description: Gets the road with the specified id (e.g. A1)

ids.description: Comma-separated list of road identifiers e.g. "A406, A2" (a full list of supported road identifiers can be found at the /Road/ endpoint)

actions.title: Road_Disruption
actions.description: Get active disruptions, filtered by road ids

ids.description: Comma-separated list of road identifiers e.g. "A406, A2" use all for all to ignore id filter (a full list of supported road identifiers can be found at the /Road/ endpoint)

stripContent.description: Optional, defaults to false. When true, removes every property/node except for id, point, severity, severityDescription, startDate, endDate, corridor details, location, comments and streets

severities.description: an optional list of Severity names to filter on (a valid list of severities can be obtained from the /Road/Meta/severities endpoint)

categories.description: an optional list of category names to filter on (a valid list of categories can be obtained from the /Road/Meta/categories endpoint)

closures.description: Optional, defaults to true. When true, always includes disruptions that have road closures, regardless of the severity filter. When false, the severity filter works as normal.

actions.title: Road_Status
actions.description: Gets the specified roads with the status aggregated over the date range specified, or now until the end of today if no dates are passed.

ids.description: Comma-separated list of road identifiers e.g. "A406, A2" or use "all" to ignore id filter (a full list of supported road identifiers can be found at the /Road/ endpoint)

actions.title: Search_Get
actions.description:
Search the site for occurrences of the query string. The maximum number of results returned is equal to the maximum page size
            of 100. To return subsequent pages, use the paginated overload.

actions.title: Search_BusSchedules
actions.description: Searches the bus schedules folder on S3 for a given bus number.

actions.title: Search_MetaCategories
actions.description: Gets the available search categories.

actions.title: Search_MetaSearchProviders
actions.description: Gets the available searchProvider names.

actions.title: Search_MetaSorts
actions.description: Gets the available sorting options.

actions.title: StopPoint_GetByGeoPoint
actions.description: Gets a list of StopPoints within {radius} by the specified criteria

stopTypes.description: a list of stopTypes that should be returned (a list of valid stop types can be obtained from the StopPoint/meta/stoptypes endpoint)

radius.description: the radius of the bounding circle in metres (default : 200)

useStopPointHierarchy.description: Re-arrange the output into a parent/child hierarchy

modes.description: the list of modes to search (comma separated mode names e.g. tube,dlr)

categories.description: an optional list of comma separated property categories to return in the StopPoint's property bag. If null or empty, all categories of property are returned. Pass the keyword "none" to return no properties (a valid list of categories can be obtained from the /StopPoint/Meta/categories endpoint)

returnLines.description: true to return the lines that each stop point serves as a nested resource

actions.title: StopPoint_MetaCategories
actions.description: Gets the list of available StopPoint additional information categories

actions.title: StopPoint_MetaModes
actions.description: Gets the list of available StopPoint modes

actions.title: StopPoint_MetaStopTypes
actions.description: Gets the list of available StopPoint types

actions.title: StopPoint_GetByMode
actions.description: Gets a list of StopPoints filtered by the modes available at that StopPoint.

modes.description: A comma-seperated list of modes e.g. tube,dlr

page.description: The data set page to return. Page 1 equates to the first 1000 stop points, page 2 equates to 1001-2000 etc. Must be entered for bus mode as data set is too large.

actions.title: StopPoint_DisruptionByMode
actions.description: Gets a distinct list of disrupted stop points for the given modes

modes.description: A comma-seperated list of modes e.g. tube,dlr

actions.title: StopPoint.Search.get
actions.description: Search StopPoints by their common name, or their 5-digit Countdown Bus Stop Code.

query.description: The query string, case-insensitive. Leading and trailing wildcards are applied automatically.

modes.description: An optional, parameter separated list of the modes to filter by

faresOnly.description: True to only return stations in that have Fares data available for single fares to another station.

maxResults.description:
An optional result limit, defaulting to and with a maximum of 50. Since children of the stop point heirarchy are returned for matches,
            it is possible that the flattened result set will contain more than 50 items.

lines.description: An optional, parameter separated list of the lines to filter by

includeHubs.description: If true, returns results including HUBs.

actions.title: StopPoint.Search.query.get
actions.description: Search StopPoints by their common name, or their 5-digit Countdown Bus Stop Code.

query.description: The query string, case-insensitive. Leading and trailing wildcards are applied automatically.

modes.description: An optional, parameter separated list of the modes to filter by

faresOnly.description: True to only return stations in that have Fares data available for single fares to another station.

maxResults.description:
An optional result limit, defaulting to and with a maximum of 50. Since children of the stop point heirarchy are returned for matches,
            it is possible that the flattened result set will contain more than 50 items.

lines.description: An optional, parameter separated list of the lines to filter by

includeHubs.description: If true, returns results including HUBs.

actions.title: StopPoint_GetServiceTypes
actions.description: Gets the service types for a given stoppoint

id.description: The Naptan id of the stop

lineIds.description: The lines which contain the given Naptan id (all lines relevant to the given stoppoint if empty)

modes.description: The modes which the lines are relevant to (all if empty)

actions.title: StopPoint_GetBySms
actions.description: Gets a StopPoint for a given sms code.

id.description: A 5-digit Countdown Bus Stop Code e.g. 73241, 50435, 56334.

output.description: If set to "web", a 302 redirect to relevant website bus stop page is returned. Valid values are : web. All other values are ignored.

actions.title: StopPoint_GetByType
actions.description: Gets all stop points of a given type

types.description:
A comma-separated list of the types to return. Max. approx. 12 types. 
            A list of valid stop types can be obtained from the StopPoint/meta/stoptypes endpoint.

actions.title: StopPoint.ids.get
actions.description: Gets a list of StopPoints corresponding to the given list of stop ids.

ids.description:
A comma-separated list of stop point ids (station naptan code e.g. 940GZZLUASL). Max. approx. 20 ids.
            You can use /StopPoint/Search/{query} endpoint to find a stop point id from a station name.

includeCrowdingData.description: Include the crowding data (static). To Filter further use: /StopPoint/{ids}/Crowding/{line}

actions.title: StopPoint_Disruption
actions.description: Gets all disruptions for the specified StopPointId, plus disruptions for any child Naptan records it may have.

ids.description:
A comma-seperated list of stop point ids. Max. approx. 20 ids.
            You can use /StopPoint/Search/{query} endpoint to find a stop point id from a station name.

getFamily.description: Specify true to return disruptions for entire family, or false to return disruptions for just this stop point. Defaults to false.

flattenResponse.description: Specify true to associate all disruptions with parent stop point. (Only applicable when getFamily is true).

actions.title: StopPoint_Arrivals
actions.description: Gets the list of arrival predictions for the given stop point id

id.description: A StopPoint id (station naptan code e.g. 940GZZLUASL, you can use /StopPoint/Search/{query} endpoint to find a stop point id from a station name)

actions.title: StopPoint_ReachableFrom
actions.description: Gets Stopoints that are reachable from a station/line combination.

id.description: The id (station naptan code e.g. 940GZZLUASL, you can use /StopPoint/Search/{query} endpoint to find a stop point id from a station name) of the stop point to filter by

lineId.description: Line id of the line to filter by (e.g. victoria)

serviceTypes.description: A comma-separated list of service types to filter on. If not specified. Supported values: Regular, Night. Defaulted to 'Regular' if not specified

actions.title: StopPoint_Crowding
actions.description: Gets all the Crowding data (static) for the StopPointId, plus crowding data for a given line and optionally a particular direction.

id.description: The Naptan id of the stop

line.description: A particular line e.g. victoria, circle, northern etc.

direction.description: The direction of travel. Can be inbound or outbound.

actions.title: StopPoint_Direction
actions.description: Returns the canonical direction, "inbound" or "outbound", for a given pair of stop point Ids in the direction from -> to.

id.description: Originating stop id (station naptan code e.g. 940GZZLUASL, you can use /StopPoint/Search/{query} endpoint to find a stop point id from a station name)

toStopPointId.description: Destination stop id (station naptan code e.g. 940GZZLUASL, you can use /StopPoint/Search/{query} endpoint to find a stop point id from a station name)

lineId.description: Optional line id filter e.g. victoria

actions.title: StopPoint_Route
actions.description: Returns the route sections for all the lines that service the given stop point ids

id.description: A stop point id (station naptan codes e.g. 940GZZLUASL, you can use /StopPoint/Search/{query} endpoint to find a stop point id from a station name)

serviceTypes.description: A comma-separated list of service types to filter on. If not specified. Supported values: Regular, Night. Defaulted to 'Regular' if not specified

actions.title: StopPoint.id.placeTypes.get
actions.description: Get a list of places corresponding to a given id and place types.

id.description: A naptan id for a stop point (station naptan code e.g. 940GZZLUASL).

placeTypes.description: A comcomma-separated value representing the place types.

actions.title: StopPoint_GetCarParksById
actions.description: Get car parks corresponding to the given stop point id.

stopPointId.description: stopPointId is required to get the car parks.

actions.title: StopPoint_GetTaxiRanksByIds
actions.description: Gets a list of taxi ranks corresponding to the given stop point id.

stopPointId.description: stopPointId is required to get the taxi ranks.

actions.title: TravelTime_GetCompareOverlay
actions.description: Gets the TravelTime overlay.

timeOfDayId.description: The id for the time of day (AM/INTER/PM)

width.description: The width of the requested overlay.

height.description: The height of the requested overlay.

travelTimeInterval.description: The total minutes between the travel time bands

actions.title: TravelTime_GetOverlay
actions.description: Gets the TravelTime overlay.

timeOfDayId.description: The id for the time of day (AM/INTER/PM)

width.description: The width of the requested overlay.

height.description: The height of the requested overlay.

travelTimeInterval.description: The total minutes between the travel time bands

actions.title: Vehicle_GetEmissionsSurchargeCompliance
actions.description: Gets the Emissions Surcharge compliance for the Vehicle

actions.title: Vehicle_GetUlezCompliance
actions.description: Gets the Ulez Surcharge compliance for the Vehicle

actions.title: Vehicle_Get
actions.description: Gets the predictions for a given list of vehicle Id's.

ids.description: A comma-separated list of vehicle ids e.g. LX58CFV,LX11AZB,LX58CFE. Max approx. 25 ids.
